title: J-K: Militant killed in gunfight with security forces in Bandipora | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
J-K: Militant killed in gunfight with security forces in Bandipora india Updated: Feb 14, 2017 09:50 IST Abhishek Saha, Srinagar, Hindustan Times Security forces launched a cordon and search operation in Parray Mohalla in Hajin area of the district this morning following intelligence inputs. (File Photo) 
A militant was killed in an encounter in northern Kashmir’s Bandipora on Tuesday morning, police said. 
Zulfikar Azad, Bandipora superintendent of police, told HT that in a gun battle wa raging in Hajin area of the district. 
The gunfight started at 5.30am after security forces launced a search operation operation following intelligence inputs about the presence of militants. 
Further details are awaited. 
This was the second such encounter in a week after four militants and two soldiers were killed in south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Sunday. Two army personnel injured during encounter b/w forces and terrorists in Hajin area of Bandipora district in J&K pic.twitter.com/yPYsLgKEBk — ANI (@ANI_news) February 14, 2017 
Two civilians also were killed --- one caught on the crossfire and the other died when forces opened fire to quell protests. 
The situation in the Valley has worsened after Sunday’s violence, and a shutdown was called on Monday by the separatist leadership in protest against the civilian deaths. 
On Wednesday, there is a Kulgam Chalo march called by the separatist leaders. tags
